title: What Willian has told friends about Juventus transfer as Chelsea prepare contract offer
text:
Chelsea ace Willian has reportedly ruled out a move to Juventus (Picture: Getty)

Chelsea star Willian has reportedly told friends he has no desire to join Juventus – because of Maurizio Sarri.

Willian’s current Chelsea contract is set to expire next summer and the Brazilian is free to talk to other clubs in January.

Juventus and Barcelona have both expressed interest in signing the 31-year-old but he has ruled out the chances of signing for the Italian champions.

According to the Daily Express, Willian has told pals he is not interested in joining Juve as he disliked Sarri’s style of football while he was at Stamford Bridge.

Frank Lampard wants the Brazilian to sign a new deal (Picture: Getty)

Willian was forced to adopt a more limited role in the Chelsea team under Sarri but has revived his career in the Premier League this season under Frank Lampard.

Scoring two goals in his last two starts – including the winner in the Champions League clash against Lille on Wednesday – Willian has established himself as one of Lampard’s key players.

And new Chelsea manager and club legend Lampard is keen for Willian to extend his stay in west London and put pen to paper on a new deal.

Earlier in the week, Willian was asked whether there was an update on his contract situation and said: ‘No, no, nothing.

‘[But] yes, I am still relaxed. I am calm, I am relaxed. I wait for the club.’

Lampard, meanwhile, heaped praise on Willian after overseeing his first Champions League win as a manager.

‘Really important – he’s a top player,’ Lampard said of the Brazilian.

‘I want to see him happy. I want to see a smile on his face because his work ethic has been brilliant.

‘It’s a lovely balance for the young players. We need to have competition in attack and out wide because it must be like that, they must be on edge.’

On Sunday, Chelsea return to Premier League action with a trip to St Mary’s to face Southampton.
